pUoXSZXCP-yn2djlXBZUjg.text: I don't know what to say about this place anymore. They once had a purpose for The Working Man back at the turn of the 1900s. Now it's just stereotypical Pittsburgh food. Can't say I've ever go back can't recommend that you ever go there in the first place. If you want fries and slaw and your sandwich you can do that at your own house.

HhHRe0EPCAVssyTL3elUAw.text: This is for the location in Hampton, Allison Park. I had awful experience, but the general manager reached out to me and sent me a gift card. I gave it another try, Robert was our server and he was great and we had a great experience.

OeSZwS28nkKV9ZS7E_nU0w.text: We love this place.  It's our family Go To!  But....please don't offer the No Wait app if you don't plan to use it.  We just showed up to a 25 minute wait.   This seems to happen often on Sundays.   And when we asked at the front desk about the wait we were told "oh, I don't have the password for that"!!

-nu4LFE3AWcXgsriA66VlA.text: Been to several including the original one. Always had great food great service. This location, was horrible. Won't be back. Took forever to get seated, took even longer to get our drink order taken let alone brought to the table. Our waitress was new, but even taking that into consideration.....it took almost 45 minutes for our food to come out of the kitchen and there were lots of empty tables. NOT happy.

gfM-ism2Tdi1QVBfDDTECg.text: Visited this location for the first time last night and it was really good. Better than the cranberry location we thought. Delicious sandwiches and wings. Fast and friendly service. And our two year old was not cooperating with dinner, but our server couldn't have been more understanding about it. Our new primanti's spot

UdmGsFq8vrVsTUFG8r7M1g.text: Went for dinner tonight. Food was good,quick and beers weren't to bad price wise. After we left we parked out back and sidewalk by back door is a grease pit and my wife slipped. What manager would not see this.

DYXWuBTvUnxIa3KnVJ43zw.text: Primantis Bros is a must for us because no matter how busy or how crowded, the service and food is always impeccable.  And it is the place to be whenever the Steelers, Penguins and Pirates are playing.  It's the fun Pittsburgh place to be in.

5UlwGPuY-Jat9_HsxL2q0w.text: Very disappointed!  Restaurant has been open for 1 month and the kitchen still can't keep up. There is 20 min wait and 25% of the tables are empty because the kitchen can't keep up.  Is this due to inexperience or poor management? Food was good; wait staff did a great job - just took a long time to get our food and it didn't all come at the same time.   Went back a couple of weeks later and things were a lot better!

Xnjn0vYBSMgmw0-sE4bz0g.text: Second time here just as disappointing as first. Fries stone cold the bread is pretty dry and there are 3 to 4 other tables here.  We have now been waiting for 15 Min on a remake with a 3 year old it's the worst we are never leaving here

W1k90O7fflthunkWBd6tMQ.text: first of all, i love primantis and its a regular spot for me and friends. but, tonight we had an unpleasant experience. i ordered a pastrami sandwich and there was hardly any pastrami on it. my friend ordered a ham sandwich and it came with almost no ham and there were no fries. the atmosphere was great and the server was okay but sort of rude. i would still recommend this place

OltlVM25-nxI5gGvOKkz6Q.text: I know I'm being very aggressive with a two star rating. However, when I arrived there was a 15 minute wait was greeted politely. And requested a booth if all possible. Was explained that there is no guarantee and I understand. Once seated me and my significant other were placed in the smallest table top in the place. We were waited on by friendly waiter however the order was messed up from beginning to end. Asked for water with lemon, no lemon. Ordered an item with no tomatoes it came with tomatoes. Ordered a salad with extra shredded cheese and extra ranch. Neither of those came on it. I'm very forgiving and understand mistakes happen. But this was not a super busy night the place was not packed just really awful service. We asked to speak to manager, and we did. After kindly explain to him all that we had experience. He was a younger gentleman who seemed not to even care about our complaints. I would not recommend this place as a friendly enjoyable local restaurant. Perhaps it needs new management and a more caring staff

p4AtGVRzatIfmRy8On0Xmw.text: Great sandwiches, great service. The bar is the place to sit...reminds you a a hometown bar and not a chain... highly recommend if you like sandwiches...

W7SHQrlv0gfEDz2emCIyFA.text: I moved from out of state a couple yrs ago. And I heard really good things about P-bros. And then they put one in down the rd and I had to go. It is worth all the hype. The sandwiches are awesome. I don't even like coleslaw but I love these sandwiches. The only thing left for improvement would be the service. I know it's new and they are probably working through a few kinks, but the service was slower and the food took a while to come out. When it did it was cold.

fDVVgKcoSN6cHChBWa6rCg.text: I live in Gibsonia and on most occassions we get take out from this location.  To be fair the sandwiches are great but the pizza is only average.  I am used to the market square location and the sandwiches are on pare and have exceeded my expectations for a surburbon location.  The food is always ready on time or even a little before they give me for a time (which I really appreciate).  For take out I would highly recomend this location for sandwiches but not necessarily the pizza.

oWKEJ_xi6giATUGLtPt-VA.text: Not the same. Original location is the best obviously, but this is the worst tasting suburban location. Pizza wasn't bad but is far behind other locations I have been to . My go to sandwich is pastrami with egg. I decided to get a double meat pastrami and egg sandwich, the meat is tasteless. I bit into it and immediately disappointed. No matter how much hot sauce I put on this , it won't help... I'm not even going to call and complain because it's only $10 I don't care. If you are in the area just drive to harmarville , much better.

xWH93QkNR5s7kdrLSB0Ybw.text: Sandwich was all bread and lettuce with very little meat - I don't understand the draw to this place - never again

fSJNtrVhHK3o_K2LWzIP3A.text: The wife and I love Primanti's and we were excited to see one open in Hampton. The service has been great and the few issues we had were addressed immediately. For example, our wings did not appear to be cooked. The issue was taken care of by the manager right away. Another time, there was very little meat on the sandwich and the wings were cold Again, it was taken care of right away. The food is fresh and very tasty. I do understand that every new restaurants will have some flaws but I am optimistic that this place will receive five stars once the kinks are straightened out. I think the food at this Primanti's location is excellent and we look forward to supporting a local franchise business.

o9MZhWvnAHs8mXJfAGaioA.text: A friend and I stopped in for a late lunch this past Friday... we agreed to split the featured sandwich which was the beef brisket. As is always the case - the presentation was deniably awesome- 2 huge hunks of bread stuffed with meat, fries, cheese & coleslaw - all held together & speared with a steak knife.  I  couldn't wait!   Well after that first bite , everything changed There was no discernible 'beef' taste...it lacked flavor, was lukewarm at best and  the brisket was fatty.  After expressing our disappointment to the server she offered us another sandwich and we chose the pastrami. I did take a little nibble and it seemed to be ok, so I wrapped the rest up to take home.  Later that evening I decided to deconstruct the sandwich -I removed the bread, coleslaw & tomato and put the pastrami & fries in a pan to reheat.  I can't tell you how shocked I was when I took the pastrami off the bread slice ...there was literally nothing there See, when the sandwich was served the pastrami was visible hanging out at the edge, which gave the impression that it was thick and consistent on the entire piece of bread, which, sadly, was not the case. I'm Western Pennsylvania born & raised so I do like my fair share of meat. I was thoroughly disappointedI also found no evidence of cheese on the sandwich unless that little bit of white on the edge of the meat represented some. I decided to chronicle my experience in hopes that Primanti Bros will see it and step up their game.  Thanks for letting me vent. #thisisnotmyoldprimantis

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States
Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. #thisisnotmyoldPrimantis

yDEtX8HR2nFrl-beSRni2w.text: I've been a Primanti's fan for years so I decided to try out the new location in Hampton.   It's the worst Primanti's I've been to so far.   I've enjoyed all of the other locations more than this one.  To be fair and give the Hampton location a fair try, I've eaten there four times so far.   Each time it has been way too busy (packed with people) and the food takes FOREVER to be served.   At our last visit, we waited over a half hour for our salad, wings, and sandwiches.   The server didn't have the sense to even bring out the salad before the rest of the food.     It's always way too noisy.  They have a windowed enclosure on the one side of the building and it's too cold in the winter.    The food was good there a couple of times and a couple of times the food was crappy.    It's a gamble.

eiI2PgYlMPDIka0IyqhWGg.text: Sandwiches are bigger than I remember. Waiter was pretty good. It has been a while since I've stopped at one of these places but it was judt as good as I remember.

OgcMHTDpa0qd-XYCN_3uPg.text: Stopped in tonight for some wings and they were absolutely delicious. Highly suggest the garlic park flavor. Mia the server took amazing care of us and we will definitely be back to see her

aWJhGyJomBrgHOG4GhkuYQ.text: Good food, great atmosphere. Nice casual place when visiting Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. Drinking white Russians and had the 2nd best seller sandwich.

vS8FBO3e8z4bTJkzu_g2bw.text: I, personally, do not understand why everyone from Pittsburgh raves about Primanti sandwiches. As someone from Pittsburgh, I don't particularly think they are better sandwiches than average, but most Pittsburghers say that it's a staple. Most people go for the experience of saying that they've been to Primanti Bros.

_ks5HYdAKaAhAJZGT6VyRQ.text: Why is this place held in such high esteem in Pittsburgh?  Can it really be because of the fact that you can hold a meal in one hand while you're driving an eighteen-wheeler?

vqhlAxnvpKz2QsrgoxZFqA.text: The food is overrated and the service is some of the worst of had. Anyone who says this place is a Pittsburgh staple needs to try good food.

5RRuoRPVRgbTDyWIS0sPpw.text: Ate here today, now sick in the stomach !!  Had the jumbo. Very bad choice. They should take it off the menu!  BUYER BEWARE!!!

5NSce1jeRHfh-2eMmc0tLQ.text: Staff has been personable and attentive every time we have been to this location. Nice late night sandwich special after 9. "Double meat" is generously portioned when asked...

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States
Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States

FPg1QqFOOkP90fN5q_PJAA.text: This might be the worst restaurant in the area! The service was awful the waitress was rude and disrespectful. She couldn't take a simple order of boneless BBQ wings right instead I got bone-in dry rub with a ridiculous amount of nasty grease at the bottom. The chili cheese nachos didn't come with cheese, the chips wee soggy and the only thing on it was beans. Overall this was the worst experience at a restaurant in a long time. Gross place.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. What is this garbage!

stDP7o-0eU0uQXN_4dSjLw.text: Great consistency and always amazing food. Their happy hour is the best around - half off everything. The bone-in wings and slices of pizza are recommended.

vhtsavaGRRVjSLedgxXs1A.text: Known for there sandwiches. Pizza at Hampton location OUTSTANDING. Worth the extra travel.

z6FyoxnuNlUqXfYYdc42IQ.text: We are both from the area and couldn't be more happy that they put a Primanti Bros in Allison Park.  This particular Primanti Bros has daily specials that you cannot beat. Every time we walk in, no matter what the day is, it seems they have a good special. It is a good atmosphere with a clean setting. The food is awesome of course, we highly recommend this location.

QHiMJjj0ahDzRniKFeC-Ng.text: Primantis is BAE  I will never ever let it go. I will follow it to the depths of the sea even after our ship goes down. Thank you for never giving up on me like Jack never gave up on Rose. This is my favorite place to eat more than any of the other thousands of places I have eaten in my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States
Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States
Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States

0HrLPErLGEQlCU8l-5H4Zg.text: The satellite Primanti's locations leave a lot to be desired, and Hampton may be the worst I've been to thus far.  The suburban locations lose the charm and edge that made Primanti's a Pittsburgh icon, and make just as drastic sacrifices in food.  The expanded menu would best be avoided.  They make one thing well, and that's the standard Primanti's sandwich.  If you're interested in anything else, you're better off eating elsewhere.  Service was slow at the Hampton location, and it felt like they tried to cram too many tables into the space.  The tables were uncomfortably close, and we couldn't so much as adjust our chairs without bumping people at another table.  The sandwiches were alright, but below the quality I'm used to.  It was an alright meal, but I won't go back.  If you want Primanti's, it's worth making the 20 minute drive to one of the original locations.

H_tg1wOuFLn-d80jEs5Rew.text: Love having this location close to home. Staff are friendly and the food is always fantastic.

gKroV9kQYRjkbL0IZAh-fw.text: Maybe I'm not the appropriate demographic for this restaurant but am wholly unimpressed with the food options as I don't eat red meat. The turkey sandwich perhaps had a slice of turkey on it but I can't be sure. It was mostly cabbage and soggy French fries (which I generally like tremendously). Honestly, just gross.

pVzeOY41gtYNEiDAo2ktoA.text: Yuck  The food sucks and is full of grease on a huge white starchy bread , but that's not all folks  Smokers are welcome in this low brow yinzer establishment   Here you have a big football fan base  ( lots of big guts too)!  Great for blue collar eatin'

5AIPnVoSscGi9QF3Rw_cKg.text: If I could give zero stars I would, we stopped for a late lunch and we were ignored for 20 minutes, no one even came over to greet us, after several staff members came by and didn't even acknowledge us. the place was dead barely any customers so it wasn't like they were slammed, so after being ignored we left and got fast service at a restaurant up the road, as a result of this we will not be going back to primantis

4K3ymtNOP7BjXo9zIf9m3Q.text: Low brow  Gross concoction   No appeal whatsoever   Yinzers with no standards like this place

N-0WjktJg_Fl17w2ndWKlQ.text: The scenery of this restraint is super unique! I love it! They play the coolest music, too. But let's not forget the most important part - food! There are so many delicious options on the menu it's hard to choose! The fries are super delicious, sometimes I come here just because I'm craving their fries! Primanti Bros is great for eating in and for take out. I have yet to have a complaint for these amazing sandwiches! Don't hesitate to come and try this amazing lunch and dinner spot!

sZam5vslUpeBmXuK_J8ITA.text: Primanti Bros is a chain restaurant that is nothing like the original restaurant.  Okay, maybe one or two things are the same.  I'll say those are beers and sandwiches.    If you've never been to one before the sandwich has the sides inside.  No need for a side unless you want to share with others.  My ultimate favorite is the When Pigs Fly.  It has ham, turkey, and bacon on it, plus the other normal toppings.  I'm never disappointed of the tasty goodness this combination provides.    They've got plenty of beer on tap, nothing crazy but you can surely find something tasty to enjoy.  This location has a center island bar with one half (or third) of the restaurant in a garage type room that opens up to the outside.  Although, I've never seen them open it up... even on nice days.  This room is nice but the acoustics can be quite challenging as nothing absorbs the sounds.  This is a good place to go when you're really hungry and craving a sandwich (their pizza isn't too bad either)!

MtIVHPCsIMvyENguaceVwA.text: The Primanti Bros in Allison Park is a great addition to the community! The service here is generally pretty fast and the food is of good quality, with solid portions for the pricing. I have enjoyed every meal I've had at this location thus far and will continue to go back. Also, I am very excited about their app/rewards program, which I think is customer focused. I am happy to be able to earn points for future gift certificates as well as see upcoming deals/offers and like that there is the ability to order online right through the app. Overall, I cannot complain!

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. Half of the Sicilian cheesesteak

9RTanCdoGugaivhTGGkNSw.text: I wrote a review about an incident that happened  Saturday and I was in fact back at the restaurant since and it was nice and accommodating as before. Still s great place to eat!

Y3ggNxK_skwZE4qNDZA73A.text: Im someone who has enjoyed Primantis' sandwiches since I was a kid going to the main one in the strip district. Now this place looks nice, service was ok but the quality of my steak sandwich was lacking. I came here two weeks after they opened up this location and had a horrible experience so I gave them the benefit of the doubt and figure ill try again some time later . So I went in about a week ago and service wasnt bad. But my steak sandwich was really lacking. It took me 20 mins to get ( I was by myself) then the steak patty was dry and barely warm. Also what happened to having a ton of fries on the sandwich? I literally counted 8 fries? I mean really? The fries are the cheapest product on the sandwich!  Well I guess if i ever get a craving for it again ill make the trip to the strip.

rta0iYnAQ7UxqOXZf0BNFw.text: Ridiculously loud inside. You can barely hear the hostess or waitress when you order. The workers have trouble hearing each other. Not enjoyable in the least bit. Comparable restaurants nearby without all of the chaos.

qTxX1qYeuEj-VpTOrHbOBA.text: They gave me the wrong sandwich. Instead of a Sicilian cheese steak hoagie I was given an italian hoagie. We were given the wrong pizza size and topping. This is the second time I've been unhappy with this restaurant

4FYkgNMmgDLdp-qx8Yvneg.text: If you can't make it to some of the older, or original locations this location will do just fine. The food was pretty good, and there are definitely some pros to the suburban restaurants vs the urban locations. Our favorite thing to do is split and share two sandwiches (each get a half of the others.)  1. Knife to cut your own sandwich. This is GREAT! Our kids eat a little over half of their own sandwich and take the rest home. Now we can cut our own size sandwich for the kids without it getting overly messy. (Cut in half, and cut the other half perpendicular, or just cut a 3/4 sandwich.)  2. Bright, open, and clean location.  3. Ragin' Cajun sandwich was most definitely not ragin' at all. I feel it was very under-seasoned, not spicy at all. This is one of our favorite sandwiches and we were surprised how lacking in spiciness it was.  4. Fairly popular for college football games. Random people clapping and cheering at the wide variety of screens available. When we entered it was about 1/3 filled and quiet, but slowly the tables started to fill. The random clapping and hollering startled us the first few times.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. THE CAPONE  (right) Capicola, salami, hot sausage and provolone cheese
Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. CAJUN CHICKEN (left)
Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. Cut your own sandwich

nXEW_d5lI70DOrQvpUEAfw.text: Yep, it's a Primanti's! but what separates this Primantis from most others in the Burgh anyway is that it really does double as an excellent sports bar.  Some do, some don't, some are middle of the road as sports bars but this Primantis has the big game or Steelers, Pittsburgh Penguins, & Buccos figured out.  Rather impressive collection of signed sports memorabilia as well not that anyone is going to check out a restaurant just for that ;-).  Check out their late night pizza, primiantis classic sandwich, and app specials and their Sunday/Monday wing specials!

k9Y1GP8d8jwC8zHPoYZVUg.text: This is your usual Primanti Bros. They seem to be perpetually understaffed, and always behind on service/food. If you're going to go here you're better off sitting at the bar. Table service is a long wait (due to short staff), and food takes forever.

6ZtitsJUBmsWYakgeKnovw.text: Went to lunch with my niece and nephews for lunch today and I got a pastrami and cheese. It should be called a slaw and fries sandwich because of one piece of meat of the sandwich. Would of gave it one star but the service was good.

NJnUPuYUKDuPzugqXCeiHw.text: My boyfriend and I stopped as we were driving through. Seated immediately, and our waitress was super friendly. We both ordered the New Yorker and they came out quickly. It's a massive, massive sandwich but delicious. Neither of us were able to finish even half, but we left full and happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States

zJxgrlBIMsXjZVCaegN_FQ.text: Always awesome and completely reasonably priced.  At this primantis , Sundays and Mondays are 69c wing night.  Primantis is my favorite non-independent restaurant (small chain) in the city. It took a few hits when they were sold but I believe something changed in the last two years giving is individual owners more control of running their restaurant and it's gotten closer to the original design of the restaurant!

cCUS2a0Qt6KAoyBHWp2ERw.text: Honestly the only primantis that I've had a better sandwich than at the original in the strip district. Been here about 4 times, very consistent!

3a3iHqWAGbQ6UtuF76YgoQ.text: Love the location of this Primanti's however the management leaves a lot to be desired. I have been going there since it opened and the food and drinks are typical Primanti's. Here's the but...the management is not friendly at all! The only manager whoever introduced himself is the guy Tim. He is super friendly and always greets the customer. I have seen him go above and beyond! However the other managers are no where near as friendly.  But kudos to Tim all the regulars know that he is the heartbeat behind this location!

LGHoY6vqgCsmKy5ObXIQVw.text: This is a must stop whenever I am in Pittsburgh, which is monthly. Food is well priced, good, lots of cold beers on tap and the place is clean. What else do you need? Tr

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. Southern Tier IPA
Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. The Cajon Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States. The Brothers Burger

2manMS5ACsULAZM9MG2XDw.text: As an avid Primanti's goer, I can hands down say that this Primanti Bros is the best. This location offers the full menu, not just the sandwiches. The wait staff is friendly, as well as at the top of their games- You won't be struggling to find your waiter/waitress to get a refill, they are always around and checking in. In terms of food, the taste also goes above other locations I've been to. Also, Primanti's new rewards program means a $10 gift card for every $100 spent, and if you go as frequently as my family, it adds up fast! A perfect spot to watch the Pens win the cup again!

photos.caption: Photo of Primanti Bros - Hampton Township, PA, United States

g42h-MjfSWouW6_xbKacLg.text: I don't normally write reviews but... the service at this location is one of the worst that I have ever had to deal with.  We "checked in" online with a 10-20 minute wait not a big deal. When we got to the restaurant the hostess removed us from the wait list and re added us. She told us we did not lose our place in line. There were 3 parties ahead of us. Yet we waited over 45 minutes and saw numerous tables sat before us. When we complained to the manager suddenly a table is ready for us. This is by far the worst service we have ever received from any restaurant. I would avoid this location. The management and hostesses at this location need to be retrained.

JfEIdeDiuyvMjSIALFHkcw.text: I Visited over the summer. Normally I love primantis but my last visit was a disappointment. The restaurant was nearly empty and they chose to seat us in the open enclosure area. I knew i didnt want to sit there, but I held my breath. Normally outdoor seating is acceptable but my goodness this was a disaster. It is feet from a major highway leaving a very windy and loud dining experience. The sandwich was sub-par. Cold meat, fries and minimal coleslaw. Very bland.  I am hoping next time it will be better.

GQaxAWwydJeO8dq-0ZtOig.text: Sandwiches are piled high with grilled meat, melted provolone cheese, coleslaw, fries, and ripe tomatoes on Italian bread. I had the Joe, Dick and Stanley sandwich of capicola, oven-roasted turkey, roast beef and provolone cheese. Wow! Good selection of craft beers too. Service is so-so, but who cares when you get your monster sandwich.
